headline.print_headline: Obesity Research Takes High-Tech Twist at Florida School
headline.main: Obesity Research Takes High-Tech Twist at Florida School

docs.lead_paragraph: Freshmen at Florida's Lakewood High School lined up against gold and black gymnasium mats on Friday to have their height and weight measured, an assessment to launch a novel study on fighting teenage obesity with trendy new technology.
docs.snippet: Freshmen at Florida's Lakewood High School lined up against gold and black gymnasium mats on Friday to have their height and weight measured, an assessment to launch a novel study on fighting teenage obesity with trendy new technology.

docs.abstract: Adirondack Grazers Cooperative, type of co-op for grass-fed cows, helps members with farms from the Adirondacks to the Pennsylvania border market and sell their beef; organization goes beyond logistical support, providing sense of hope and community for small farmers in state where family farms are rapidly vanishing.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Adirondack Grazers Cooperative, based in upstate New York, markets and sells beef for its 36 members. But it also provides hope at a time family farms are rapidly vanishing.
docs.snippet: The Adirondack Grazers Cooperative, based in upstate New York, markets and sells beef for its 36 members. But it also provides hope at a time family farms are rapidly vanishing.

headline.print_headline: North Korea Reveals Leader Is ‘Not Feeling Well’
headline.main: North Korea Reveals Leader Is ‘Not Feeling Well’

docs.abstract: North Korea's state-run television station runs video of leader Kim Jong-un walking with a limp, a rare revelation about his health; some analysts have speculated that Kim could be suffering from gout or arthritis, in addition to his obesity.
docs.lead_paragraph: In a rare revelation about the top leader’s health, North’s Central TV showed Mr. Kim walking with a limp while visiting a factory.
docs.snippet: In a rare revelation about the top leader’s health, North’s Central TV showed Mr. Kim walking with a limp while visiting a factory.

headline.print_headline: New York Grand Jury to Hear Evidence in Police Choke Hold Death
headline.main: New York Grand Jury to Hear Evidence in Police Choke Hold Death

docs.lead_paragraph: A grand jury will begin hearing evidence next week in the controversial case of Eric Garner, who died after New York police put him in a banned choke hold.
docs.snippet: A grand jury will begin hearing evidence next week in the controversial case of Eric Garner, who died after New York police put him in a banned choke hold.

docs.abstract: Teenagers trying to lose weight should engage in an exercise program that includes both aerobic and resistance training, a randomized trial has found. It also found that diet without exercise accomplishes little.
docs.snippet: Teenagers trying to lose weight should engage in an exercise program that includes both aerobic and resistance training, a randomized trial has found. It also found that diet without exercise accomplishes little.

headline.print_headline: Big Soda Makers Agree on Effort to Cut Americans’ Drink Calories
headline.main: Soda Makers Coca-Cola, PepsiCo and Dr Pepper Join in Effort to Cut Americans’ Drink Calories

docs.abstract: Coca-Cola, PepsiCo and Dr Pepper Snapple Group, three largest soda companies, pledge to cut number of sugary drink calories that Americans consume by one-fifth in about a decade; say they will change practices like marketing, distribution and packaging to encourage less consumption of calorie-heavy drinks.
docs.lead_paragraph: The three companies said they would change practices like marketing to encourage less consumption of calorie-heavy drinks.
docs.snippet: The three companies said they would change practices like marketing to encourage less consumption of calorie-heavy drinks.

headline.print_headline: Soda Makers Pledge to Reduce Calorie Consumption
headline.main: Soda Makers Pledge to Reduce Calorie Consumption

docs.lead_paragraph: Coke, Pepsi and Dr Pepper said Tuesday they'll work to reduce the calories Americans get from beverages by 20 percent over the next decade by more aggressively marketing smaller sizes, bottled water and diet drinks.
docs.snippet: Coke, Pepsi and Dr Pepper said Tuesday they'll work to reduce the calories Americans get from beverages by 20 percent over the next decade by more aggressively marketing smaller sizes, bottled water and diet drinks.
